intro: Veronica scutellata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
